p: Molecular tools for identifying quarantine insect pests are essential for managing outbreaks, especially in view of the setup of international shared diagnostic protocols (Augustin et al. 2012). Of these molecular methods, the LAMP technique (Tani et al. 2007; Tomlinson et al. 2010a; Moradi et al. 2014; Blaser et al. 2018; Panno et al. 2020) can be used for a direct diagnosis of insect specimens (adults or larvae), as well as for an indirect analysis of insect DNA present in residues deriving from the trophic activity (e.g., frass as in Kyei-Poku et al. 2020).
